descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
WRITING THE FEATURE FILM
COURSE DESCRIPTION

Students in this intensive workshop will learn to write and analyze feature films with emphasis on emotional logic, plot logic and organization, seeking mastery of all aspects of the art and craft of screenwriting. The class will be structured through lectures, reading assignments, viewing of streamed films, discussion, in-class viewing of film clips and workshop of student assignments. Writing assignments will be arranged to mirror a writer's creative process starting with ideas and culminating in the successful completion of a plot outline and a minimum of 30 to 40 pages of an original feature-length screenplay. An alternative track toward completing the page requirements may be available. Students may complete a plot outline and an entire first draft of a feature screenplay with a submission schedule determined in consultation with instructor.
Pre-requisite: RTVF 260 Copying Estimate: 300 pages
